column2: Tindak Malaysia (2024), LAPORAN PILIHANRAYA UMUM DEWAN UNDANGAN NEGERI SABAH - 1986, Suruhanjaya Pilihan Raya, Government Gazette P.U. (B) 204 1/5/1986, Government Gazette P.U. (B) 23 22/5/1986, New Straits Times 8/5/1986.  Refer to 1986_Other_Sources for other sources

This file does not have the candidate's age information. On 5th June 1986 (Bernama Report), PBS and USNO were accepted as Barisan Nasional (BN) members. According to the 1986 Elections Report by EC,  Berjaya (BN) gained 54124 votes though counted votes for Berjaya 54121. According to Government Gazette P.U. (B) 23 22/5/1986 - there are no errors in the total count of 54121 votes of Berjaya and total ballots issued of 312542. EC report may have errors.  This impacted total votes of 312545 (according to the EC report) instead of 312542. During the campaign period in April 1986, the two PCBS candidates of DUN Sri Tanjung and DUN Balung pledged support for PBS. PCBS is the Malay acronym of Sabah Chinese Consolidated Party (SCCP) which contested in 1981 Sabah State Elections. Parti Murut Sabah contested in the Sabah via five Independents as the party symbol wasn't register in time for the elections. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or omissions arising from the original data or its derivatives.
